channel.title: Chapter 18: Boosting on Introduction to Machine Learning (I2ML)
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 18: Boosting on Introduction to Machine Learning (I2ML)

item.title: Chapter 18.01: Introduction to Boosting / AdaBoost
item.description: In this section, we introduce the pioneering AdaBoost algorithm.

item.title: Chapter 18.02: Boosting Concept
item.description: In this section, we discuss the general boosting principle: performing gradient descent in function space by repeatedly fitting new base learner components to the current pseudo-residuals.

item.title: Chapter 18.03: Boosting Illustration
item.description: We show several illustrative regression examples to visualize the boosting principle.

item.title: Chapter 18.04: Boosting Regularization
item.description: Powerful boosting learners tend to overfit. We discuss the number of iterations, base learner complexity, and shrinkage as countermeasures.

item.title: Chapter 18.05: Boosting for Classification
item.description: We introduce boosting algorithms for both binary and multiclass classification with several examples.

item.title: Chapter 18.06: Gradient Boosting with Trees I
item.description: We discuss trees as the most popular base learners in gradient boosting, with special emphasis on model structure and interaction depth.

item.title: Chapter 18.07: Gradient Boosting with Trees II
item.description: We explain how terminal coefficients are found in a risk-minimal manner and briefly discuss tree-based boosting for multiclass problems.

item.title: Chapter 18.08: XGBoost
item.description: We introduce XGBoost, a highly efficient, tree-based boosting system with additional regularizers.

item.title: Chapter 18.09: Component Wise Boosting Basics 1
item.description: We introduce the concept of CWB, common base learners and built-in feature selection.

item.title: Chapter 18.10: Component Wise Boosting Basics 2
item.description: We explain the handling of categorical features and of the intercept and introduce a practical example.

item.title: Chapter 18.11: CWB and GLMs
item.description: We explain the relationship between CWB and GLMs.

item.title: Chapter 18.12: Advanced CWB
item.description: We explain the details of nonlinear BLs and splines, decomposition for splines, fair base learner selection and feature importance and PDPs.
